title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhongjun Qu. Author, copyright holder. Jungmo Yoon. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Qu Z, Yoon J (2025). QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects Regression Discontinuity Design. R package version 1.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects under the Regression Discontinuity Design},   author = {Zhongjun Qu and Jungmo Yoon},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1.0}, }

what: QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects under the Regression Discontinuity Design — QTE.RD-package
title: QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects under the Regression Discontinuity Design — QTE.RD-package
text: Provides comprehensive methods testing, estimating, conducting uniform inference quantile treatment effects (QTEs) sharp regression discontinuity (RD) designs, incorporating covariates implementing robust bias correction methods Qu, Yoon, Perron (2024) doi:10.1162/rest_a_01168 .

title: QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects under the Regression Discontinuity Design — QTE.RD-package
text: package QTE.RD includes four main functions: rd.qte estimates QTEs provides uniform confidence bands, without covariates, without robust bias correction. rdq.test conducts tests three hypotheses, related significance treatment effects, homogeneous treatment effects, uniformly positive negative treatment effects. rdq.bandwidth implements two bandwidth selection rules: cross-validation bandwidth MSE optimal bandwidth. plot.qte generates figures summarizing treatment effects along confidence bands.

title: QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects under the Regression Discontinuity Design — QTE.RD-package
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323

title: QTE.RD: Quantile Treatment Effects under the Regression Discontinuity Design — QTE.RD-package
text: Zhongjun Qu qu@bu.edu Jungmo Yoon jmyoon@hanyang.ac.kr

title: Cross-validation bandwidth — cv.bandwidth
text: cv.bandwidth implements cross-validation bandwidth selection rule. function rdq.bandwidth calls function obtain CV bandwidth.

title: Cross-validation bandwidth — cv.bandwidth
code: cv.bandwidth(y, x, z, dz, x0, val, xl, order, bdy)

title: Cross-validation bandwidth — cv.bandwidth
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x running variable. z additional covariates. dz number covariates z. x0 cutoff point. val set candidate values CV bandwidth. xl xl=0.5, CV bandwidth computed using 50% observations closest \(x_0\). order either 1 2. order=1, local linear regression used, order=2, local quadratic regression used. bdy either 0 1. bdy=1, CV bandwidth computed treating x boundary point. Otherwise, x treated interior point.

title: Cross-validation bandwidth — cv.bandwidth
text: list elements: h.cv selected CV bandwidth values median. cand values criterion function evaluated candidate value.

title: Cross-validation bandwidth — cv.bandwidth
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323

title: Epanechnikov kernel — depa
text: Epanechnikov kernel

title: Epanechnikov kernel — depa
code: depa(xx, loc = 0, scale = 1)

title: Epanechnikov kernel — depa
text: xx evaluation points. loc location parameter (normalized 0). scale scale parameter (normalized 1).

title: Epanechnikov kernel — depa
text: values.

what: Uniform confidence bands for conditional quantile processes — make.band.cq
title: Uniform confidence bands for conditional quantile processes — make.band.cq
text: make.band.cq constructs uniform confidence bands conditional quantile processes functions tau side cutoff. See make.band well. function rdq.band calls function generates uniform bands conditional quantiles.

title: Uniform confidence bands for conditional quantile processes — make.band.cq
code: make.band.cq(n.sam,Dc.p,Dc.m,Dr.p,Dr.m,dz,cov,taus,hh,Qy.p,Qy.m,      bias.p,bias.m,alpha,n.sim)

title: Uniform confidence bands for conditional quantile processes — make.band.cq
text: n.sam sample size. Dc.p simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau)\). Dc.m simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau)\). Dr.p simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau) - D_{2,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau)\). Dr.m simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau) - D_{2,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau)\). dz number covariates. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. taus vector quantiles interest. hh bandwidth values. Qy.p estimated conditional quantiles \((x_{0}^{+},z)\). Qy.m estimated conditional quantiles \((x_{0}^{-},z)\). bias.p estimated bias terms \((x_{0}^{+},z)\). bias.m estimated bias terms \((x_{0}^{-},z)\). alpha number 0 1, desired significance level. n.sim number simulation repetitions.

title: Uniform confidence bands for conditional quantile processes — make.band.cq
text: list elements: qp conditional quantile estimates \(x_{0}^{+}\) (.e., cutoff) without bias correction. qp.r bias corrected conditional quantile estimates \(x_{0}^{+}\). qm conditional quantile estimates \(x_{0}^{-}\) (.e., cutoff) without bias correction. qm.r bias corrected conditional quantile estimates \(x_{0}^{-}\). ubandp uniform confidence band conditional quantiles \(x_{0}^{+}\) without bias correction. ubandp.r uniform confidence band conditional quantiles \(x_{0}^{+}\) robust bias correction. ubandm uniform confidence band conditional quantiles \(x_{0}^{-}\) without bias correction. ubandm.r uniform confidence band conditional quantiles \(x_{0}^{-}\) robust bias correction. sp standard errors conditional quantile estimates without bias correction \(x_{0}^{+}\). sp.r standard errors conditional quantile estimates robust bias correction \(x_{0}^{+}\). sm standard errors conditional quantile estimates without bias correction \(x_{0}^{-}\). sm.r standard errors conditional quantile estimates robust bias correction \(x_{0}^{-}\).

title: Uniform confidence bands for conditional quantile processes — make.band.cq
code: n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) tlevel2 = c(0.05,tlevel,0.95) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel)) hh2 = rep(2,length(tlevel2)) sel = tlevel2 %in% tlevel  ab = rdq(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel2,h.tau=hh2,cov=0) delta = c(0.05,0.09,0.14,0.17,0.19,0.17,0.14,0.09,0.05) fp = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qp.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.p,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta,cov=0) fm = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qm.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.m,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta,cov=0) bp = rdq.bias(y[d==1],x[d==1],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fp$ff[(d==1),],cov=0) bm = rdq.bias(y[d==0],x[d==0],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fm$ff[(d==0),],cov=0)  sa = rdq.sim(x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,dz=0,cov=0,tt=tlevel,hh,hh,fxp=fp$ff,fxm=fm$ff,n.sim=200) ba.cq = make.band.cq(n,Dc.p=sa$dcp,Dc.m=sa$dcm,Dr.p=sa$drp,Dr.m=sa$drm,dz=0,cov=0, taus=tlevel,hh,Qy.p=as.matrix(ab$qp.est[sel,]),Qy.m=as.matrix(ab$qm.est[sel,]), bias.p=bp$bias,bias.m=bm$bias,alpha=0.1,n.sim=200)

what: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — make.band
title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — make.band
text: make.band constructs uniform confidence bands using output rdq.sim. function rdq.band calls function generates uniform bands.

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — make.band
code: make.band(n.sam,Dc.p,Dc.m,Dr.p,Dr.m,dz,cov,taus,hh,Qy.p,Qy.m,      bias.p,bias.m,alpha,n.sim)

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — make.band
text: n.sam sample size. Dc.p simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau)\). Dc.m simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau)\). Dr.p simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau) - D_{2,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau)\). Dr.m simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau) - D_{2,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau)\). dz number covariates cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. taus vector quantiles interest. hh bandwidth values. Qy.p estimated conditional quantiles \((x_{0}^{+},z)\). Qy.m estimated conditional quantiles \((x_{0}^{-},z)\). bias.p estimated bias terms \((x_{0}^{+},z)\). bias.m estimated bias terms \((x_{0}^{-},z)\). alpha number 0 1, desired significance level. n.sim number simulation repetitions.

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — make.band
text: list elements: qte QTE estimates without bias correction. qte.r QTE estimates bias correction. uband uniform confidence band QTE without bias correction. uband.r uniform confidence band QTE robust bias correction. sig standard errors bias-uncorrected QTE estimates. sig.r standard errors bias-corrected QTE estimates. values reflect impact bias correction estimation precision.

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — make.band
code: n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) tlevel2 = c(0.05,tlevel,0.95) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel)) hh2 = rep(2,length(tlevel2)) sel = tlevel2 %in% tlevel  ab = rdq(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel2,h.tau=hh2,cov=0) delta = c(0.05,0.09,0.14,0.17,0.19,0.17,0.14,0.09,0.05) fp = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qp.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.p,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta=delta,cov=0) fm = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qm.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.m,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta=delta,cov=0) bp = rdq.bias(y[d==1],x[d==1],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fp$ff[(d==1),],cov=0) bm = rdq.bias(y[d==0],x[d==0],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fm$ff[(d==0),],cov=0)  sa = rdq.sim(x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,dz=0,cov=0,tt=tlevel,hh,hh,fxp=fp$ff,fxm=fm$ff,n.sim=200) ba = make.band(n,Dc.p=sa$dcp,Dc.m=sa$dcm,Dr.p=sa$drp,Dr.m=sa$drm,dz=0,cov=0, taus=tlevel,hh,Qy.p=as.matrix(ab$qp.est[sel,]),Qy.m=as.matrix(ab$qm.est[sel,]), bias.p=bp$bias,bias.m=bm$bias,alpha=0.1,n.sim=200)

title: QTE plots — plot.qte
text: plot.qte generates plots summarizing QTE estimates uniform confidence bands, helping users visualize results. also makes plots conditional quantile processes side cutoff.

title: QTE plots — plot.qte
code: # S3 method for class 'qte' plot(x, ptype = 1, ytext = NULL, mtext = NULL, subtext = NULL, ...)

title: QTE plots — plot.qte
text: x object class "qte" "summary.qte" produce rd.qte. ptype either 1 2. Set ptype=1 QTE plots, ptype=2 conditional quantile plots. default value 1. ytext y-axis label. mtext title plot. subtext subtitles (used conditional quantile plots ). ... optional arguments plot

title: QTE plots — plot.qte
text: plot(s) QTE estimates uniform confidence bands.

title: QTE plots — plot.qte
code: # Without covariate n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=0,bias=1) plot(A)   y.text = "test scores" m.text = "QTE and Uniform band" plot(A,ytext=y.text,mtext=m.text)   A2 <- summary(A,alpha=0.1) plot(A2)   z = sample(c(0,1),n,replace=TRUE) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + d*z + rnorm(n) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=cbind(x,z),d=d,x0=0,z0=c(0,1),tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=1,bias=1) A2 <- summary(A,alpha=0.1)  y.text = "test scores" m.text = c("D=0","D=1") plot(A2,ytext=y.text,mtext=m.text)   # conditional quantile plots n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=0,bias=1) A2 <- summary(A,alpha=0.1)  y.text = "test scores" m.text = "Conditional quantile functions" sub.text = c("D=0 group","D=1 group") plot(A2,ptype=2,ytext=y.text,mtext=m.text,subtext=sub.text)

what: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
title: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
text: rd.qte main function QTE.RD package. cov=1, estimates QTE subgroup defined covariates. cov=0, estimate QTE without covariates. bias=1, corrects bias QTE estimates obtains robust confidence band bias=0, bias correction implemented.

title: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
code: rd.qte(y, x, d, x0, z0=NULL, tau, bdw, cov, bias)

title: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x vector (matrix) covariates, first column running variable. d numeric vector, treatment status. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. example, female dummy z included, z0 = 1 may indicate female subgroup. tau vector quantiles interest. bdw bandwidth value(s). 'bdw' scalar, interpreted bandwidth median. See function rdq.bandwidth select bandwidth. bandwidths rest quantiles computed automatically using formula Yu Jones (1998). vector dimension 'tau', function use values respective quantiles accordingly. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. bias either 0 1. bias=1, QTE estimate bias corrected robust confidence band Qu, Yoon, Perron (2024) produced. bias=0, bias correction implemented.

title: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
text: list elements: qte QTE estimates. uband uniform confidence band QTE. bias=1, band robust capturing effect bias correction. bias=0, bias correction implemented. sigma standard errors quantile level. bias=1, value captures effect bias correction. bias=0, bias correction implemented. qp.est conditional quantile estimates right side \(x_{0}\) (\(D=1\) group). qm.est conditional quantile estimates left side \(x_{0}\) (\(D=0\) group).

title: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323 Keming Yu M. C. Jones (1998), “Local Linear Quantile Regression,” Journal American Statistical Association, 93(441), 228–237; https://doi.org/10.2307/2669619

title: QTE and its uniform confidence band. — rd.qte
code: # Without covariate n <- 500 x <- runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d <- (x > 0) y <- x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel <- seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=0,bias=1)  # (continued) With covariates z <- sample(c(0,1),n,replace=TRUE) y <- x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + d*z + rnorm(n) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=cbind(x,z),d=d,x0=0,z0=c(0,1),tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=1,bias=1)

what: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
text: rdq.band produces uniform confidence bands QTEs without bias correction. function used rd.qte generate uniform bands.

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
code: rdq.band(y, x, d, x0, z0 = NULL, tau, bdw, cov, alpha)

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x vector (matrix) covariates, first column running variable. d numeric vector, treatment status. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. example, female dummy included, z0 = 1 may indicate female subgroup. tau vector quantiles interest. bdw bandwidth value(s). 'bdw' scalar, interpreted bandwidth median. bandwidths rest quantiles computed automatically using formula Yu Jones (1998). vector dimension 'tau', function use values respective quantiles accordingly. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. alpha number 0 1, desired significance level.

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
text: qte QTE estimates without bias correction. qte.cor bias corrected QTE estimates. uband uniform confidence band QTE without bias correction. uband.robust uniform confidence band QTE robust bias correction. sig standard errors quantile level estimates without bias correction. sig.r standard errors quantile level estimates robust bias correction. uband.p uniform confidence band conditional quantile estimates right side cutoff, without bias correction. uband.robust.p uniform confidence band conditional quantile estimates right side cutoff, robust bias correction. uband.m uniform confidence band conditional quantile estimates left side cutoff, without bias correction. uband.robust.m uniform confidence band conditional quantile estimates left side cutoff, robust bias correction.

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323 Keming Yu M. C. Jones (1998), “Local Linear Quantile Regression,” Journal American Statistical Association, 93(441), 228–237; https://doi.org/10.2307/2669619

title: Uniform confidence bands for QTE — rdq.band
code: # Without covariate n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) D = rdq.band(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=0,alpha=0.1)  # (continued) With covariates z = sample(c(0,1),n,replace=TRUE) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + d*z + rnorm(n) D = rdq.band(y=y,x=cbind(x,z),d=d,x0=0,z0=c(0,1),tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=1,alpha=0.1)

title: Bandwidth estimation — rdq.bandwidth
text: rdq.bandwidth implements two bandwidth selection rules obtains cross-validation (CV) bandwidth MSE optimal bandwidth.

title: Bandwidth estimation — rdq.bandwidth
code: rdq.bandwidth(y, x, d, x0, z0=NULL, cov, cv, val,hp=NULL,pm.each=1,      bdy=1,p.order=1,xl=0.5)

title: Bandwidth estimation — rdq.bandwidth
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x vector (matrix) covariates, first column running variable. d numeric vector, treatment status. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. cv either 0 1. cv=1, CV MSE optimal bandwidths produced. cv=0, MSE optimal bandwidth produced. val set candidate values CV bandwidth. hp pilot bandwidth estimate nuisance parameters MSE optimal bandwidth. used cv=0. cv=1, CV bandwidth used pilot bandwidth compute MSE optimal bandwidth. pm.either 0 1. pm.=1, CV bandwidths side cutoff obtained separately. bdy either 0 1. bdy=1, CV bandwidth uses boundary point procdure. p.order either 1 2. p.order=1, local linear regression used, p.order=2, local quadratic regression used. xl xl=0.5, CV bandwidth use 50% observations closest \(x_0\).

title: Bandwidth estimation — rdq.bandwidth
text: list elements: cv selected CV bandwidth median. opt.p MSE optimal bandwidth median right side \(x_0\). opt.m MSE optimal bandwidth median left side \(x_0\).

title: Bandwidth estimation — rdq.bandwidth
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323

title: Bias estimation — rdq.bias
text: rdq.bias estimates bias terms using local quadratic quantile regression.

title: Bias estimation — rdq.bias
code: rdq.bias(y, x, dz, x0, z0, taus, h.tau, h.tau2, fx, cov)

title: Bias estimation — rdq.bias
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x vector (matrix) covariates, first column running variable. dz number covariates. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. taus vector quantiles interest. h.tau bandwidth values (specified quantile level), estimating conditional quantiles. h.tau2 bandwidth values local quadratic quantile regression, estimating bias terms. fx conditional density estimates. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0.

title: Bias estimation — rdq.bias
text: list elements: bias bias estimates. b.hat estimate \(B_{v}(x,z,\tau)\) term. See Qu, Yoon, Perron (2024).

title: Bias estimation — rdq.bias
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168

title: Bias estimation — rdq.bias
code: n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) tlevel2 = c(0.05,tlevel,0.95) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel)) hh2 = rep(2,length(tlevel2))  ab = rdq(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel2,h.tau=hh2,cov=0) delta = c(0.05,0.09,0.14,0.17,0.19,0.17,0.14,0.09,0.05) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel)) fe = rdq.condf(x,Q=ab$qp.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.p,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta=delta,cov=0) be = rdq.bias(y[d==1],x[d==1],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fe$ff[(d==1),],cov=0)

title: Conditional density estimation — rdq.condf
text: rdq.condf estimates conditional density functions using differencing method.

title: Conditional density estimation — rdq.condf
code: rdq.condf(x, Q, bcoe, taus, taul, delta, cov)

title: Conditional density estimation — rdq.condf
text: x vector (matrix) covariates. Q vector estimated conditional quantiles. bcoe quantile regression coefficient estimates. taus vector quantiles interest. taul vector quantiles used conditional density estimation. needed estimate tail parts conditional density functions precisely. delta bandwidths estimating conditional density. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0.

title: Conditional density estimation — rdq.condf
text: conditional density function estimates

title: Conditional density estimation — rdq.condf
code: n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel))  ab = rdq(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,h.tau=hh,cov=0) delta = 0.186 fe = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qp.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.p,taus=0.5,taul=tlevel,delta=delta,cov=0)

what: Estimate the QTE under the RDD — rdq
title: Estimate the QTE under the RDD — rdq
text: rdq estimates QTE RDD without covariates. function used rd.qte generate QTE estimates.

title: Estimate the QTE under the RDD — rdq
code: rdq(y, x, d, x0, z0 = NULL, tau, h.tau, cov)

title: Estimate the QTE under the RDD — rdq
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x vector (matrix) covariates, first column running variable. d numeric vector, treatment status. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. example, female dummy included, z0 = 1 may indicate female subgroup. tau vector quantiles interest. h.tau bandwidth values (specified quantile level). cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0.

title: Estimate the QTE under the RDD — rdq
text: list elements: qte QTE estimates. qp.est conditional quantile estimates right side \(x_{0}\) (D=1 group). qm.est conditional quantile estimates left side \(x_{0}\) (D=0 group). bcoe.p quantile regression coefficients right side \(x_{0}\). bcoe.m quantile regression coefficients left side \(x_{0}\).

title: Estimate the QTE under the RDD — rdq
Simulation the asymptotic distributions — rdq.sim
text: rdq.sim produces iid draws asymptotic distribution conditional quantile process estimate.

title: Simulation the asymptotic distributions — rdq.sim
code: rdq.sim(x, d, x0, z0, dz, cov, tt, hh, hh2, fxp, fxm, n.sim)

title: Simulation the asymptotic distributions — rdq.sim
text: x vector (matrix) covariates. d numeric vector, treatment status. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. dz number covariates. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. tt vector quantiles. hh bandwidth values (specified quantile level). hh2 bandwidth values local quadratic quantile regression. fxp conditional density estimates right side \(x_0\). fxm conditional density estimates left side \(x_0\). n.sim number simulation repetitions.

title: Simulation the asymptotic distributions — rdq.sim
text: list elements: dcp realizations asymptotic distribution conditional quantile process, right side \(x_0\). dcm realizations asymptotic distribution conditional quantile process, left side \(x_0\). drp realizations asymptotic distribution bias corrected conditional quantile process, right side \(x_0\). drm realizations asymptotic distribution bias corrected conditional quantile process, left side \(x_0\).

title: Simulation the asymptotic distributions — rdq.sim
code: n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) tlevel2 = c(0.05,tlevel,0.95) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel)) hh2 = rep(2,length(tlevel2))  ab = rdq(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel2,h.tau=hh2,cov=0) delta = c(0.05,0.09,0.14,0.17,0.19,0.17,0.14,0.09,0.05) fp = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qp.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.p,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta,cov=0) fm = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qm.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.m,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta,cov=0) sa = rdq.sim(x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,dz=0,cov=0,tt=tlevel,hh,hh,fxp=fp$ff,fxm=fm$ff,n.sim=200)

title: tests for QTE — rdq.test
text: rdq.test provides testing results hypotheses treatment effects concerning () treatment significance, (ii) homogeneity effects quantiles, (iii) positive negative dominance hypothesis.

title: tests for QTE — rdq.test
code: rdq.test(y,x,d,x0,z0=NULL,tau,bdw,cov,bias,alpha,type,std.opt=1)

title: tests for QTE — rdq.test
text: y numeric vector, outcome variable. x vector (matrix) covariates, first column running variable. d numeric vector, treatment status. x0 cutoff point. z0 value covariates evaluate effects. example, female dummy included, z0 = 1 indicates female subgroup. tau vector quantiles interest. bdw bandwidth value(s). 'bdw' scalar, interpreted bandwidth median. bandwidths rest quantiles computed automatically using formula Yu Jones (1998). vector dimension 'tau', function use values respective quantiles accordingly. cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. bias either 0 1. bias=1, QTE estimate bias corrected robust confidence band Qu, Yoon, Perron (2024) produced. bias=0, bias correction implemented. alpha number 0 1, desired significance level. alpha=0.1, one get 90% uniform band. type value 1–4. Set type 1 test null hypothesis zero treatment effect alternative hypothesis significant treatment effects; set type 2 test null hypothesis homogeneous treatment heterogeneous treatment effects; set type 3 test null hypothesis uniformly non-negative treatment effects presence negative effects; set type 4 test null hypothesis uniformly non-positive treatment effects presence positive effects quantiles. std.opt either 0 1. std.opt=1, test statistic standardized variance equalized across quantiles; std.opt=0, test standardized.

title: tests for QTE — rdq.test
text: list elements: statistic test statistics. cr.va critical values. p.value p values.

title: tests for QTE — rdq.test
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323

title: tests for QTE — rdq.test
code: # Without covariate n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) B = rdq.test(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=0,bias=1,alpha=c(0.1,0.05),type=c(1,2,3))  # (continued) With covariates z = sample(c(0,1),n,replace=TRUE) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + d*z + rnorm(n) B = rdq.test(y=y,x=cbind(x,z),d=d,x0=0,z0=c(0,1),tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=1,bias=1, alpha=c(0.1,0.05),type=c(3,4))

title: Run tests — run.test
text: run.test performs hypothesis testing. function rdq.test calls function run tests.

title: Run tests — run.test
code: run.test(n.sam,dz,taus,hh,Dc.p,Dc.m,Dr.p,Dr.m,Qy.p,Qy.m,bias.p,bias.m,      cov,bias,alpha,n.sim,test.type,std.opt)

title: Run tests — run.test
text: n.sam sample size. dz number covariates. taus vector quantiles interest. hh bandwidth values. Dc.p simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau)\). Dc.m simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau)\). Dr.p simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau) - D_{2,v}(x_{0}^{+},z,\tau)\). Dr.m simulated values \(D_{1,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau) - D_{2,v}(x_{0}^{-},z,\tau)\). Qy.p estimated conditional quantiles \((x_{0}^{+},z)\). Qy.m estimated conditional quantiles \((x_{0}^{-},z)\). bias.p estimated bias terms \((x_{0}^{+},z)\). bias.m estimated bias terms \((x_{0}^{-},z)\). cov either 0 1. Set cov=1 covariates present model; otherwise set cov=0. bias either 0 1. bias=1, QTE estimate bias corrected robust confidence band Qu, Yoon, Perron (2024) produced. bias=0, bias correction implemented. alpha number 0 1, desired significance level. n.sim number simulation repetitions. test.type value 1–4. Set type 1 test null hypothesis zero treatment effect alternative hypothesis significant treatment effects; set type 2 test null hypothesis homogeneous treatment heterogeneous treatment effects; set type 3 test null hypothesis uniformly non-negative treatment effects presence negative effects; set type 4 test null hypothesis uniformly non-positive treatment effects presence positive effects quantiles. std.opt either 0 1. std.opt=1, test statistic standardized variance equalized across quantiles; std.opt=0, test standardized.

title: Run tests — run.test
text: list elements: test.stat test statistics. cr.value critical values. p.val p values.

title: Run tests — run.test
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168

title: Run tests — run.test
code: n = 500 x = runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d = (x > 0) y = x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) tlevel2 = c(0.05,tlevel,0.95) hh = rep(2,length(tlevel)) hh2 = rep(2,length(tlevel2)) sel = tlevel2 %in% tlevel  ab = rdq(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel2,h.tau=hh2,cov=0) delta = c(0.05,0.09,0.14,0.17,0.19,0.17,0.14,0.09,0.05) fp = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qp.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.p,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta,cov=0) fm = rdq.condf(x=x,Q=ab$qm.est,bcoe=ab$bcoe.m,taus=tlevel,taul=tlevel2,delta,cov=0) bp = rdq.bias(y[d==1],x[d==1],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fp$ff[(d==1),],cov=0) bm = rdq.bias(y[d==0],x[d==0],dz=0,x0=0,z0=NULL,taus=tlevel,hh,hh,fx=fm$ff[(d==0),],cov=0)  sa = rdq.sim(x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,dz=0,cov=0,tt=tlevel,hh,hh,fxp=fp$ff,fxm=fm$ff,n.sim=200) bt <- run.test(n,dz=0,taus=tlevel,hh,Dc.p=sa$dcp,Dc.m=sa$dcm,Dr.p=sa$drp,Dr.m=sa$drm, Qy.p=as.matrix(ab$qp.est[sel,]),Qy.m=as.matrix(ab$qm.est[sel,]),bias.p=bp$bias,bias.m=bm$bias, cov=0,bias=1,alpha=0.1,n.sim=200,test.type=1,std.opt=1)

what: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
title: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
text: summary.qte returns uniform confidence bands standard errors QTE estimates.

title: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
code: # S3 method for class 'qte' summary(object, alpha, ...)

title: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
text: object object class "qte" produced rd.qte. alpha number 0 1, desired significance level. example, alpha=0.1, one get 90% uniform band. ... optional arguments.

title: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
text: list elements: qte QTE estimates. uband uniform confidence band QTE. bias=1, band robust capturing effect bias correction. bias=0, bias correction implemented. sigma standard errors quantile level. bias=1, value captures effect bias correction. bias=0, bias correction implemented. qp.est conditional quantile estimates right side \(x_{0}\) (\(D=1\) group). qm.est conditional quantile estimates left side \(x_{0}\) (\(D=0\) group). uband.p uniform confidence band conditional quantiles right side \(x_{0}\). uband.m uniform confidence band conditional quantiles left side \(x_{0}\).

title: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
text: Zhongjun Qu, Jungmo Yoon, Pierre Perron (2024), "Inference Conditional Quantile Processes Partially Linear Models Applications Impact Unemployment Benefits," Review Economics Statistics; https://doi.org/10.1162/rest_a_01168 Zhongjun Qu Jungmo Yoon (2019), "Uniform Inference Quantile Effects Sharp Regression Discontinuity Designs," Journal Business Economic Statistics, 37(4), 625–647; https://doi.org/10.1080/07350015.2017.1407323

title: Uniform confidence band for QTE. — summary.qte
code: # Without covariate n <- 500 x <- runif(n,min=-4,max=4) d <- (x > 0) y <- x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + rnorm(n) tlevel = seq(0.1,0.9,by=0.1) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=x,d=d,x0=0,z0=NULL,tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=0,bias=1) A2 <- summary(A,alpha=0.1)  # (continued) With covariates z <- sample(c(0,1),n,replace=TRUE) y <- x + 0.3*(x^2) - 0.1*(x^3) + 1.5*d + d*z + rnorm(n) A <- rd.qte(y=y,x=cbind(x,z),d=d,x0=0,z0=c(0,1),tau=tlevel,bdw=2,cov=1,bias=1) A2 <- summary(A,alpha=0.1)

title: QTE.RD 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-18 Initial CRAN submission.

title: QTE.RD 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-08-29 First revision. added summary.qte() several print methods. added p-values outcome rdq.test().
